comments:
We had a Subclipse user enter a bug report:
http://subclipse.tigris.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=590

I have copied the relevant text at the end of this message.  Basically, this is the line of code in Subclipse that is ultimately producing the error.  

IProject[] projects = ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().getRoot().getProjects();

Any ideas as to what we are doing wrong?

Here is the text from the bug report in our issue tracker:

I get the following error maybe once or twice a week.  I'm using Subclipse 1.1.8
and am not usually even doing anything Subclipse related when it happens. . .

org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: Malformed tree.
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.getChildNodes(DeltaDataTree.java:522)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.getChildren(DeltaDataTree.java:534)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.getChildIDs(ElementTree.java:331)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.getChildren(ElementTree.java:347)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Container.getChildren(Container.java:91)
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkspaceRoot.getProjects(WorkspaceRoot.java:182)
at
org.tigris.subversion.subclipse.core.resources.SVNWorkspaceRoot.pathForLocation(SVNWorkspaceRoot.java:199)
If this is on Eclipse 3.2 or earlier, it's likely a dup of bug 134364 (since fixed).

In the bug I referenced, this is what the user indicated for what they were running:

eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905
java.version=1.4.2_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -data /home/tbecker/workspaces/trunk -os linux -ws gtk
-arch x86

If you can tell that this is 3.2 from the build ID, feel free to close.

Thanks, confirmed.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 134364 ***
